title: What if 'Operation Dropshot' did happen? - Quora

response.answer_text: Contingency planning for “Operation Dropshot” did happen in 1957. The plan was continuously updated after that, I’ve been told by a normally reliable government source. And it’s results would not have been pretty. Operation Dropshot - WikipediaFrom Wikipedia: “Dropshot included mission profiles that would have used 300 nuclear bombs and 29,000 high-explosive bombs on 200 targets in 100 cities and towns…”  “…to wipe out 85 percent of the Soviet Union's industrial potential at a single stroke. Between 75 and 100 of the 300 nuclear weapons were targeted to destroy Soviet combat aircraft on the ground.”  There is a detailed description of the plan here:American Plan for War with the Soviet Union 1957 Operation Unthinkable was a similar plan of the UK originally conceived in 1945 and continuously updated…Operation Unthinkable - Wikipedia Some people know that Plan Totality was the original USA plan for attacking the USSR:Plan Totality - WikipediaHowever, Plan Totality was merely a disinformation ploy.

300 unprovoked nuclear attacks on Russian industrial and population centers? The holocaust would have paled in comparison. Millions of casualties within a few weeks/months. The west would have some problems to make the case for being morally superior, especially after a world war that was essentially won by Soviet effort.  The threshold for use of nuclear weapons would have become ridiculously low. (Remember during the whole of the cold war not a single nuclear bomb was actually dropped on anyone.) The main adversary would not have had a chance to balance out a West that had evidently gone completely insane. I am not sure such an American hegemony would have been good for anyone.   Not that a Soviet Union with nuclear weapons was a good thing. But a U.S. with no inhibition to use the weapons would not be either.
